channel.title: [317]HOW TO CHANGE YOUR CLIENT IP - Simple & Detailed
channel.description:
I've decided to start making quick, detailed tutorials.
HOW TO CHANGE YOUR CLIENT IP:
Step 1: Open up your client's files.
Step 2: Find Gui.java
Step 3: Hold & Release Ctrl+F
Step 4: Search for [code]Serverip =[/code] Then you should find the ip or it should say 127.0.01.
Step 5: Change it to your servers IP, save it, and compile.
BOOM, it's done.
If you want to change the name of the client also, scroll down to the bottom of the client and search for this code: [code]public static String frameTitle =[/code] and change it your the title of your server.
If you do not have an IP or do not know how to get one, you can get one at [url=http://www.no-ip.com]No-IP[/url].
If you do not have a compiler, you can use this program for editing and compiling!
[url=http://www.drjava.org]DrJava[/url]
and download Java at [url=http://java.com]Java.com[/url]
to check you Java version you should do this:
Control Panel >> Java >> About.. >> You should see the version on the top.
Thanks. :]

item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Asuyuka:

Dude GTFO, if you know how to do it, what’s the point in reading it.

For sheer boredom, because we are nosy. Why do you think we read it? Its there, and we would like to see what people are saying. People should NOT need a tutorial like this, as I have already said. This is done via CTRL+F, and searching. If they fail to try that, they fail.
